uk.ac.aber.rcs.cs211.schedulersim

Class AbstractScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.aber.rcs.cs211.schedulersim.AbstractScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scheduler

    public class AbstractScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scheduler
    This AbstractScheduler class actually implements a First-Come, First-Served scheduling algorithm. It is intended as the base class for other Schedulers, and should replace the Scheduler interface before this assignment is set next time so that the queues are maintained properly. Otherwise students tend to keep queues in a random order and getNextJob finds the correct job to return.

        public void addNewJob(Job job)
               throws SchedulerException
        Description copied from interface: Scheduler
        Add a new job onto the queue at the relevant position. This job must not already exist on the queue.
        Specified by:
        addNewJob in interface Scheduler
        Parameters:
        job - The new process job to be added.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if the job already exists on the queue.

      • getJobList

        public Job[] getJobList()
        Used to display the queue on screen. Should reflect the order in which jobs will be called to execute.
        Specified by:
        getJobList in interface Scheduler
        Returns:
        An array of jobs in order they are on the queue.

      • getNextJob

        public final Job getNextJob()
                     throws SchedulerException
        Returns the next job at the head of the ready queue. This method should only ever do this - the queue should be kept in the correct order when things are added and removed.
        Specified by:
        getNextJob in interface Scheduler
        Returns:
        the next job to execute.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if there are no jobs on the queue.

      • removeJob

        public void removeJob(Job job)
               throws SchedulerException
        Description copied from interface: Scheduler
        Remove the Job from the queue. This may be because the job has finished, or because it has become blocked waiting for I/O
        Specified by:
        removeJob in interface Scheduler
        Parameters:
        job - the job to remove.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if the job does not exist on the queue.

      • returnJob

        public void returnJob(Job job)
               throws SchedulerException
        Description copied from interface: Scheduler
        A job has had some processing done, and is now being returned to the queue. This is where a job should be moved from the front of the queue to the new position it should be occupying.
        Specified by:
        returnJob in interface Scheduler
        Parameters:
        job - A job pre-existing on the queue, being returned.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if the job does not exist on the queue.
